AutoscaleProfile.description: This is the Autoscale profile for the cluster. This will allow customer to create cluster enabled with Autoscale.

autoscaleType.description: User to specify which type of Autoscale to be implemented - Scheduled Based or Load Based.

enabled.description: This indicates whether auto scale is enabled on HDInsight on AKS cluster.

gracefulDecommissionTimeout.description: This property is for graceful decommission timeout; It has a default setting of 3600 seconds before forced shutdown takes place. This is the maximal time to wait for running containers and applications to complete before transition a DECOMMISSIONING node into DECOMMISSIONED. The default value is 3600 seconds. Negative value (like -1) is handled as infinite timeout.

enableInternalIngress.description: Whether to create cluster using private IP instead of public IP. This property must be set at create time.

content.description: Free form content of the entire configuration file.

encoding.description: This property indicates if the content is encoded and is case-insensitive. Please set the value to base64 if the content is base64 encoded. Set it to none or skip it if the content is plain text.

path.description: Path of the config file if content is specified.

values.description:
List of key value pairs
where key represents a valid service configuration name and value represents the value of the config.

managedResourceGroupName.description: A resource group created by RP, to hold the resources created by RP on-behalf of customers. It will also be used to generate aksManagedResourceGroupName by pattern: MC_{managedResourceGroupName}_{clusterPoolName}_{region}. Please make sure it meets resource group name restriction.

clusterPoolVersion.description: Cluster pool version is a 2-part version.

enabled.description: True if log analytics is enabled for cluster pool, otherwise false.

workspaceId.description: Log analytics workspace to associate with the OMS agent.

apiServerAuthorizedIpRanges.description: IP ranges are specified in CIDR format, e.g. 137.117.106.88/29. This feature is not compatible with private AKS clusters. So you cannot set enablePrivateApiServer to true and apiServerAuthorizedIpRanges at the same time. Currently, this property is not supported and please don't use it.

enablePrivateApiServer.description: ClusterPool is based on AKS cluster. AKS cluster exposes the API server to public internet by default. If you set this property to true, a private AKS cluster will be created, and it will use private apiserver, which is not exposed to public internet.

outboundType.description: This can only be set at cluster pool creation time and cannot be changed later.

ComputeResourceDefinition.description: The cpu and memory requirement definition.

memory.description: The required memory in MB, Container memory will be 110 percentile

dataDiskSize.description: Managed Disk size in GB. The maximum supported disk size for Standard and Premium HDD/SSD is 32TB, except for Premium SSD v2, which supports up to 64TB.

hive.description: Hive Catalog Option for Flink cluster.

FlinkJobProfile.description: Job specifications for flink clusters in application deployment mode. The specification is immutable even if job properties are changed by calling the RunJob API, please use the ListJob API to get the latest job information.

args.description: A string property representing additional JVM arguments for the Flink job. It should be space separated value.

entryClass.description: A string property that specifies the entry class for the Flink job. If not specified, the entry point is auto-detected from the flink job jar package.

jarName.description: A string property that represents the name of the job JAR.

jobJarDirectory.description: A string property that specifies the directory where the job JAR is located.

savePointName.description: A string property that represents the name of the savepoint for the Flink job

upgradeMode.description: A string property that indicates the upgrade mode to be performed on the Flink job. It can have one of the following enum values => STATELESS_UPDATE, UPDATE, LAST_STATE_UPDATE.

deploymentMode.description: A string property that indicates the deployment mode of Flink cluster. It can have one of the following enum values => Application, Session. Default value is Session

historyServer.description: History Server container/ process CPU and memory requirements

jobManager.description: Job Manager container/ process CPU and memory requirements

jobSpec.description: Job specifications for flink clusters in application deployment mode. The specification is immutable even if job properties are changed by calling the RunJob API, please use the ListJob API to get the latest job information.

taskManager.description: Task Manager container/ process CPU and memory requirements

storageUri.description: Storage account uri which is used for savepoint and checkpoint state.

storagekey.description: Storage key is only required for wasb(s) storage.

catalogName.description: Name of trino catalog which should use specified hive metastore.

metastoreDbConnectionAuthenticationMode.description: The authentication mode to connect to your Hive metastore database. More details: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-sql/database/logins-create-manage?view=azuresql#authentication-and-authorization

metastoreDbConnectionPasswordSecret.description: Secret reference name from secretsProfile.secrets containing password for database connection.

metastoreDbConnectionURL.description: Connection string for hive metastore database.

IdentityProfile.description: Identity Profile with details of an MSI.

enableKRaft.description: Expose Kafka cluster in KRaft mode.

enablePublicEndpoints.description: Expose worker nodes as public endpoints.

remoteStorageUri.description: Fully qualified path of Azure Storage container used for Tiered Storage.

cooldownPeriod.description: This is a cool down period, this is a time period in seconds, which determines the amount of time that must elapse between a scaling activity started by a rule and the start of the next scaling activity, regardless of the rule that triggers it. The default value is 300 seconds.

maxNodes.description: User needs to set the maximum number of nodes for load based scaling, the load based scaling will use this to scale up and scale down between minimum and maximum number of nodes.

minNodes.description: User needs to set the minimum number of nodes for load based scaling, the load based scaling will use this to scale up and scale down between minimum and maximum number of nodes.

pollInterval.description: User can specify the poll interval, this is the time period (in seconds) after which scaling metrics are polled for triggering a scaling operation.

RangerAdminSpec.description: Specification for the Ranger Admin service.

admins.description: List of usernames that should be marked as ranger admins. These usernames should match the user principal name (UPN) of the respective AAD users.

username.description: The name of the database user

RangerAuditSpec.description: Properties required to describe audit log storage.

storageAccount.description: Azure storage location of the blobs. MSI should have read/write access to this Storage account.

rangerAdmin.description: Specification for the Ranger Admin service.

rangerAudit.description: Properties required to describe audit log storage.

rangerUsersync.description: Specification for the Ranger Usersync service

RangerUsersyncSpec.description: Specification for the Ranger Usersync service

enabled.description: Denotes whether usersync service should be enabled

groups.description: List of groups that should be synced. These group names should match the object id of the respective AAD groups.

mode.description: User & groups can be synced automatically or via a static list that's refreshed.

userMappingLocation.description: Azure storage location of a mapping file that lists user & group associations.

users.description: List of user names that should be synced. These usernames should match the User principal name of the respective AAD users.

evaluationCount.description: This is an evaluation count for a scaling condition, the number of times a trigger condition should be successful, before scaling activity is triggered.

scalingMetric.description: Metrics name for individual workloads. For example: cpu

count.description: User has to set the node count anticipated at end of the scaling operation of the set current schedule configuration, format is integer.

days.description: User has to set the days where schedule has to be set for autoscale operation.

endTime.description: User has to set the end time of current schedule configuration, format like 10:30 (HH:MM).

startTime.description: User has to set the start time of current schedule configuration, format like 10:30 (HH:MM).

defaultCount.description: Setting default node count of current schedule configuration. Default node count specifies the number of nodes which are default when an specified scaling operation is executed (scale up/scale down)

schedules.description: This specifies the schedules where scheduled based Autoscale to be enabled, the user has a choice to set multiple rules within the schedule across days and times (start/end).

timeZone.description: User has to specify the timezone on which the schedule has to be set for schedule based autoscale configuration.

parameters.description: Additional parameters for the script action. It should be space-separated list of arguments required for script execution.

services.description: List of services to apply the script action.

shouldPersist.description: Specify if the script should persist on the cluster.

timeoutInMinutes.description: Timeout duration for the script action in minutes.

type.description: Type of the script action. Supported type is bash scripts.

version.description: Version of the secret in key vault.

keyVaultResourceId.description: Name of the user Key Vault where all the cluster specific user secrets are stored.
